content: Well someone had to start this. “This strain of swine influenza that’s been cultured in a laboratory is something that’s not been seen anywhere actually in the United States and the world, so this is actually a new strain of influenza that’s been identified,” said Dr. John Carlo, Dallas Co. Medical Director (video clip here)." Odd, yet another "urban legend" or "conspiracy theory" seems to be coming to pass. Is this coincidence or is it just "that time". Apparently this virus is not a natural occurring one. So who made it? and why? How and why did it get out of the lab? Why all of a sudden are the CDC and WHO so "prepared" for something that they would have had no clue that was coming at least in the form that it came? Were they already expecting this? Or was this something THEY were playing around with and got out of the bag? I know, it's way to early for this kind of speculation...but something just does not seem to fit right. I smell something, but not exactly sure what it is... Note this topic is CONSPIRACY THEORY. If I thought this was FACT, I would not have POSTED IT here. So save it unless you want to talk about it.

title: Weaponized Flu Pandemic - Population Control?

content: 1. This cannot be a bio-weapon because its rate of infection is too limited and too low. The deathrate is also too low for it to be a bio-weapon. Unless the deathrate is being masked by the average monthly rate of aprox,3000. In which case it would be at least 2 to 3 months before the true rate would show up. 2, However, the virus could have been programed to lay dormant, and keep reproducing itself whithen it's host and continue to infect. Then mutate to a more lethal type. Some interesting work was done by the old USSR,some 30 years ago and they had some bad accidents which led to the shutting down of the projects. The PRC was doing { and is still, I believe} the same type of research.

content: Here's a world shaking statistic: More people have died from the 'normal' flu virus than by the swine flu. The CDC doesn't track anything but pediatric deaths due to influenza, but last year there were 83 children who died due to the 'normal' seasonal influenza virus. There have been two deaths in children due to the swine flu this season. There have been 800 murders by handguns in the city of Chicago in 2009. Not much of a 'weapon' is it? Sullivan013

content: The swine flu is dangerous, and health authorities should be commended for taking every precaution to stop its spread. It is NOT, however, a killer plague. It's a communicable disease which is a threat to certain groups in the community (e.g. elderly) and needs to be treated with respect... like many others.
